abstract: The proposed approval order outlines conditions that would benefit consumers by increasing competition in the broadband market.
snippet: The proposed approval order outlines conditions that would benefit consumers by increasing competition in the broadband market.
lead_paragraph: AT&T’s proposed $48.5 billion takeover of the satellite company DirecTV is on the path to receiving a regulatory green light after Tom Wheeler, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, circulated a final order on Tuesday to approve the deal with conditions.

headline.main: AT&T’s Bid for DirecTV Advances With Conditional Approval Order by F.C.C. Chief
headline.print_headline: AT&T’s Bid for DirecTV Moves Forward
